thread.title: Keep sanctuary city safe for felons, D.A. says
thread.title_full: Keep sanctuary city safe for felons, D.A. says - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Debra J. Saunders
title: Keep sanctuary city safe for felons, D.A. says
text:
Photo: Alvin Jornada, The Chronicle San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón listens as Chronicle reporter Vivian Ho asks him a question during a meeting with the Chronicle editorial board in April 8. San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón listens as Chronicle...
As he runs for re-election in November, San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón faces no opposition. It’s a cozy — if unlikely — position, when you consider that Gascón arrived in the city as a pro-death penalty Republican from Arizona in 2009 when then-Mayor Gavin Newsom picked him to be chief of police. Today, he’s the rare prosecutor who has sent a message to career criminals in the country illegally: San Francisco will make the feds really work to deport them. San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón listens as Chronicle reporter Vivian Ho asks him a question during a meeting with the Chronicle editorial board in April 8. San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón listens as Chronicle...
As he runs for re-election in November, San Francisco District Attorney George Gascón faces no opposition. It’s a cozy — if unlikely — position, when you consider that Gascón arrived in the city as a pro-death penalty Republican from Arizona in 2009 when then-Mayor Gavin Newsom picked him to be chief of police. Today, he’s the rare prosecutor who has sent a message to career criminals in the country illegally: San Francisco will make the feds really work to deport them.
